Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Medallion \Me*dal"lion\, n. [F. m['e]daillion, It. medaglione, augm. of medaglia. See {Medal}.] [1913 Webster] 1. A large medal or memorial coin. [1913 Webster]
2. A circular or oval (or, sometimes, square) tablet bearing a figure or figures represented in relief. [1913 Webster]

medallion n 1: any of various large ancient Greek coins 2: a circular helping of food (especially a boneless cut of meat); "medallions of veal" 3: an emblem indicating that a taxicab is registered 4: an award for winning a championship or commemorating some other event [syn: {decoration}, {laurel wreath}, {medal}, {palm}, {ribbon}]
